scenes.background: [Monica] raises an eyebrow, questioning your suggestion to train more people.
scenes.description: Bob adjusts his glasses. 'Training sounds good, but how do we ensure the quality of their work?'

options.text: We can implement a mentorship program to guide them through the process.
options.analysis: You show good social skills and self-regulation by suggesting a mentorship program, but emotional perception could be improved.

options.text: Quality is important, but we need to trust our team's abilities and give them room to grow.
options.analysis: You show empathy and emotional perception by emphasizing trust in the team, but the motivation to enforce quality control is lower.

options.text: We can set up regular reviews and feedback sessions to maintain high standards.
options.analysis: You focus on maintaining high standards through regular reviews, showing strong self-regulation but lower empathy.
